items.title: The Danger of Weight-Loss Drugs Going Mainstream
items.description: GLP-1s could help turn around America’s obesity epidemic. They could also bring about a new era of eating disorders for young women.

items.title: One Fire, One System: Hong Kong’s Fire Tragedy and the City That No Longer Exists
items.description: Hong Kong did not simply mishandle a tragedy; it demonstrated, once again, that it has become something fundamentally different from what it once was.

items.title: There Is No Such Thing as an Independent Agency
items.description: The Supreme Court should overrule a 1935 precedent and put presidents back in charge of executing the law.

items.title: Right to Repair Would Help Consumers and Address ‘Affordability’
items.description: The battle over the right to repair represents a clear dividing line between supporters of certain business interests and backers of a free market.

items.title: Ben Rhodes Keeps Getting It Wildly Wrong on Israel and Gaza
items.description: Setting the record straight on the recent New York Times screed by Obama’s deputy national security adviser.
